instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Imac 27" wont boot fully
threads.message:
Booting only half way then it reboots. Sometimes with a horizontal line across the top.
Tried with good boot HDD and another PSU. Same
Any idea?
I read in another post that it may need a clean ME. Could that be the case?

threads.title: Imac 27" wont boot fully
threads.message: Apply some heat to GPU and test again, ive not seen an imac with ME region failure unless somebody has messed with bios chip..

threads.title: Imac 27" wont boot fully
threads.message: What is machine is this, this is 100% GPU failure. If you have the serial number I can tell which chip is in there.

threads.title: Imac 27" wont boot fully
threads.message: It is a core i5 mid 2011 EMC 2429. Tell me if you want the board number too....

threads.title: Imac 27" wont boot fully
threads.message: That could still be several GPUs. What are the 4 last digits of the serial  number?

threads.title: Imac 27" wont boot fully
threads.message: Could be 216-0810001 with 512 VRAM (HD 6770M) still available new or 216-0811000 with 1GB VRAM (HD 6970M) hard to find real new....
